fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Edit a page in the wiki markup editor
* Highlight some piece of text and click on the link editor
* In the link editor, click the "History" tab

Expected outcome:

* The "Alias" form field in the popup will contain the text you originally highlighted

Actual outcome:

* The "Alias" form field is now blank.

Potential impact:

* Inserting links using the popup will randomly cause highlighted text to vanish without the user noticing.
fields.summary: Link text vanishes when changing tabs in insert link dialog

See ActionBreadcrumb.java which refers to a link /pages/pageinfo.action. This should now be /pages/viewinfo.action.

fields.description:
The documentation in the notation guide for the recently-updated macro specifically states that when a labels parameter is supplied that "content associated with at least one of these will be listed" with emphasis in the documentation on the "at least one" part.

The online documentation page (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recently+Updated+Content+Macro) for the macro simply describes the labels parameter as "Filter content using labels".

In any case, when the recently-updated macro is used with a labels parameter that refers to a label that does not yet exist (because no page has been authored with the label), the macro falls back to producing a simple list of recently updated content regardless of label. In fact, the results listed are accompanied by a generated message that "These labels don't exist and were ignored: (label names)".

My expectation was that when no pages were found matching "at least one" of the specified labels, that no results would be listed. I had this expectation from the documentation, and also because it made sense to me that if no pages matched the labels that no results would be returned. If I wanted a simple list of recently updated content, I wouldn't have specified a labels parameter.

My use case is that I have pages in the wiki designed to list pages according to specific labels, such as {recently-updated:labels=foo} where 'foo' is the label. Once one of my users has authored a page with such a label, then the page correctly lists the one and only corresponding page. However, until a page has been authored with the label, the page misleading provides the user with a list of recent pages with that label, when in fact the listing is clearly a listing of the most recently updated pages regardless of label.

I'd love to know if this was a recognized issue, whether the documentation is considered to be in error, and whether there are any workarounds.

Best regards,

Gavin McKenzie.
fields.summary: recently-updated macro doesn't return an empty result when no pages match the specified label(s)

fields.description:
h3. A - Special symbols inconsistently escaped
Create a page; switch to rich-text edit mode.  Type the following: {code}(?) (\?) (!) (\!){code}

The first renders as a graphic.  (My expectation is that none of them would render as a graphic, or perhaps the first _and_ the third.)

h3. B - Switching edit modes messes up escaping

Create a page, start in _rich-text_ edit mode.
Enter the text: {code}(?){code}
Switch to _wiki markup_ mode.  Notice that this was _not_ escaped, as it would be had you saved immediately (compare with scenario A, above.)
Switch back to _rich-text_ edit mode.  You'll now be looking at a red question-mark symbol.
fields.summary: Inconsistent escaping of emoticons in rich-text edit mode

fields.description:
Our eSecurity team has identified a Cross Site Scripting issue with the confluence server as follows:
Arbirtatry javascript can be injected in the following cases which can lead to escalated or invalid privileges being granted to an unauthorized user:

1) http://www.anyhost.com/confluence/pages/recentlyupdated.action?key=BE&%3E%27%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert%2856517%29%3C%2Fscript%3E=123
*This issue has been resolved in version 2.5.8 onwards. The rest of this report refers to the following issue.*

2) http://www.anyhost.com/confluence/dashboard/configurerssfeed.action/?>'"><script>alert("esec%20XSS%20attack")</script>

We would like a patch to be created for these issues if they can not be resolved with a setting or configuration.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in recently updated and configure RSS feed actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10163].
  {panel}

Confluence external links to attachments are very difficult to use because they require knowledge of arbitrary page IDs.

Example:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/133726/view.gif?version=1

It should be more meaningful, for instance when accessing an attachment in  "Home" page of the "DevTalk" wiki space

http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/DevTalk/Home/view.gif?version=1

Also,  this kind of link naming is better so that you can remove the filename part, you get the page where the attachment is residing in.
fields.summary: Attachment Link Naming

fields.description:
From the "Edit Space Labels" page, clicking on a team label that is already defined would redirect to the Confluence's Dashboard.

This is reproducible in the following Confluence version:

* 2.2.x
* 2.3.x and later

The following URL pattern would redirect user to the correct team label list:
{noformat}
http://<domainURL>/label/<spaceKEY>/team:<the team label>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Selecting a team label from Edit Space Labels page are being redirected to Dashboard

fields.description:
See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4411

It would be helpful to us if a user with view-only permissions for a space could be explicitly granted edit permissions for a page within that space. Today this does not work, as page restrictions can only serve to further restrict what is defined at a space level, not broaden that.
fields.summary: Allow page-level restrictions to relax the permissions of the space

fields.description:
When checking out a file using this plugin, the file saves correctly to the file system, however, when I attempt to check-in the file after a change from my Kubuntu desktop, using the filesystem syntax such as /path/to/file, I get an error stating:

"Please select a valid file to check-in."
fields.summary: Attachment Checkout Plugin does not check in from Linux based desktop.

fields.description:
The Apple RSS reading capabilities used by both Safari and Mail.app (since Leopard) to read RSS feeds appears to strip out the <style> tags present in the RSS feeds generated by Confluence.

These tags are used to define the diff styles to get the old and new parts to have different background colours. Since these style tags are discarded, there is no difference in the backgrounds, making the diffs effectively useless/unreadable.

I realise this isn't your "fault", since you can't really control what kind of transformations Apple's RSS reading performs to the HTML fragments you generate. However, it would be great if there was a workaround for this in confluence (there doesn't appear to be an easy way to work around it at the client side), e.g. using something other than <style> blocks to define the styles (for example, setting the appropriate properties directly in the style attribute of the various diff areas).

Otherwise, it's extremely cumbersome to keep up with a Confluence space using Apple's RSS.
fields.summary: RSS <style> tags are stripped out by Apple Safari and Mail.app RSS readers, making diffs impossible to read

fields.description:
After setting up the new version and restoring from the old backup, any new users created cannot be assigned to groups. The user has no groups in their list and trying to assign them to the confluence users does not work. No error is shown, it just returns to the same screen.

Thanks

Damien O'Rourke
fields.summary: Can't assign new users to groups

I apologize for the image being blank in many areas but I needed to sanitize the image for security reasons

fields.description:
The cache labelled "Permission Set Collections in Content Entity Objects" (com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.contentPermissionSets) currently has no size specified.  This makes it use the default size of 1000 entries.  This can fill up quite quickly, (eg in our intranet) and ContentPermissionSets are usually quite small.  It would probably be worth making this cache at least "medium" if not large.

Some customers are reporting very large numbers of sql queries like: 
{code:sql}
select contentper0_.CONTENT_ID as CONTENT_ID__, contentper0_.ID as ID__, contentper0_.ID as ID0_, 
    contentper0_.CONT_PERM_TYPE as CONT_PER2_0_, contentper0_.CONTENT_ID as CONTENT_ID0_, 
    contentper0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION4_0_, contentper0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD5_0_ 
from CONTENT_PERM_SET contentper0_ 
where contentper0_.CONTENT_ID=?    
{code}

This would probably be cut down by increasing the size of the aformentioned cache like appropriately to confluence-coherence-cache-config.xml (and confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml):

{code:xml}
<cache-mapping>
    <cache-name>com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.contentPermissionSets</cache-name>
    <scheme-name>medium</scheme-name>
</cache-mapping>
{code}
fields.summary: Improve performance by specifying a larger size for the Content Permission Set cache

1. Edit a page
2. Select some text for your link alias
3. Click the icon for insert link
4. The popup should have your selected text filled out in the alias box. Now click on one of the tabs and the alias is lost.

I assume this is the same problem with the tooltip field.

fields.description:
we are having a strange problem with confluence where when I enter valid login details, then click login, it returns me to the login screen without proceeding to the dashboard. The url used is  http://confluence.example.com

However when I try the same test at http://confluence.example.com:8080/confluence I can login using the same details as I used above, and it takes me to the dashboard.

Apache has been setup with a Proxypass setting to redirect http://confluence.example.com to http://confluence.example.com:8080/confluence

We also have crowd 1.2 setup to take care of the authentication.

We have checked the logs for Crowd, Apache and Confluence whilst attempting to login via http://confluence.example.com and no errors are found.

It appears that there is a bug in confluence which prevents the dashboard from being displayed once a user has successfully logged in.
fields.summary: Can't get past login screen with Apache as front end

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10098].
  {panel}

The edit popups for font color and emoticons are unusable because the content is offset inside the popup and mostl if not all is clipped out, and the popup is not resizeable. If I can't use the font color popup, that feature is useless; likewise emoticons.

Looks like a few FF extensions are causing the problem...

most - No Squint
also - Live PageRank
Stylish

When these are both removed, the problem goes away. 

Overall, I am unable to get the full effect of either the emoticon popup (all emoticons pushed off the page, just a sliver showing) or the font color popup (more than half the colors clipped). These give partial effects when I enable and disable them.

These three FF extensions are definitely an issue with Confluence popups, especially the emoticons, but also the font color. I know it may be their problem, not yours. I will probably keep them disabled, as none of them is utterly crucial to me. Luckily, the really important extensions seem ok.
fields.summary: FireFox extension create havoc with edit popups wrong size, offset, unresizeable -- for font color and emoticons

fields.description:
Websphere and Weblogic ship with libraries that are incompatible versions to what Confluence ships with. This can affect either PDF generation or the RSS feed builder, depending on how Websphere is configured to load classes. 

*A patch is available for this issue.* To patch the problem, do the following:

1. Stop Confluence, and remove all copies of it from your application server.
2. Locate the following jars in your Confluence WEB-INF/lib directory and move them to a backup directory elsewhere.

    * saxon-6.5.3-patched.jar
    * ss_css2-0.9.3.jar
    * xml-apis-1.0.b2.jar
    * xmlParserAPIs-2.2.1.jar

3. Download the two patched jars, [^ss_css2-0.9.3-patched.jar] and [^saxon-6.5.3-patched2.jar], and place them in the WEB-INF/lib directory.
4. Start Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence libraries incompatible with Websphere 6.0 and Weblogic 9: rss feeds or pdf generation

Some time the indexing queue stop to flush automatically. If you start a manual indexing it works, but flushing it still stuck.

There is a workaround (from Atlassian support) that is:
{panel:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
1. Shut down your Confluence instance
2. Go to <Confluence Home>/index
3. Make a backup of the directory
4. Once you have made a backup, delete the contents within the directory.
5. Restart Confluence.
6. Perform the Manual Indexing again.
{panel}

But it has the side effect to destroy all usage statistics!
Moreover it has to be done every 1-2 month on our Confluence instance.

Problem has alredy been reported [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6857] and [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6985] but was dure to the scripting macro plugin that we don't have.

It was reported [here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9871] too, but has been closed as a support issue. But it is not a configuration issue and it it occurs quite often, so it is a bug in the indexing mechanism which should be fixed.
fields.summary: Indexing get stuck

fields.description:
Hey Adnan,

We just received information that the JOLT award deadlines are coming up.  We'd like to submit Confluence for consideration, so it would be great if you could do a short video on it.  I noticed the Confluence submission from last year on e.a.c., so perhaps there's a lot we can recycle from that to make it as uncomplicated for you as possible? 

Ideally, I'd like to get everything from you this Thursday (SF Time)--Friday at the latest.  

Here's the submission guidelines:  https://www.joltnominations.com/Jolt/

I'm sorry about the short notice, we only just heard about this... 

Let's talk,

Laura

fields.description:
to reproduce:
- create a page called help:test
- create a page called help:include with the content  "\[text|help:test\]"
- create a page in another space called ds:test with the content "\{zone-template-instance:help:include\}"
- note: it may also work with \{include:help:include\}

everything should look fine to this point. now
- rename help:test to help:Test or something else
- now, the link on the help:include page is refactored to \[text|Test\]
- now, the link as displayed in the ds:test page does not link to the proper page in the help space.

What should happen:
- upon refactoring on page rename, the page help:include should read "\[text|help:Test\]"

fields.description:
The number of results reported in "Found _N_ results for query <name>" doesn't match up with the number of results actually returned via pagination, implying that two different searches are being performed.

Reported in [CSP-13368|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-13368]. The EXTERNAL_ENTITY table is implicated: it looks like this is incorrectly queried when returning the total number of users with a matching name.

This isn't a duplicate of [CONF-6389], as it's not a simple multiple of the number of users found, however it may be related to or a duplicate of [CONF-9455].
fields.summary: People Directory search returns inconsistent results

fields.description:
Ths OSUser hibernate configuration does not use the {{ResettableTableHiLoGenerator}} for row IDs in a clustered environment. This leads to cluster nodes attempting to reuse existing row IDs when inserting new user records into the table.

This will result in the following error message:

Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'CONSTRAINT NAME'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'os_user'."

Trying to insert the user repeatably should eventually succeed as the ID generator eventually catches up to an unused row ID.
fields.summary: OSUser provider does not generate IDs correctly in clustered environment
